body_content.explanation: a place where children go to be educated:
examples: a primary/secondary school
an elementary/a middle/a high school
Milton Road School
They're building a new school in the town.
She drives the kids to school every morning.
I went to school with (= I went to the same school at the same time as) Luke's brother.
I was at school with Luke's brother.
Is Emily in/at school today or is she still ill?
What did you learn at school today
Which school do you go to (formal attend)?
school lunches/uniform/buildings

body_content.explanation: the period of your life during which you go to school, or the teaching and learning activities which happen at school:
examples: Most children start/begin school at the age of five.
What do you want to do when you leave school (= finish studying at school)?
I love/hate school.
My sister teaches school (= teaches children in a school) in New York City.

body_content.explanation: the time during the day when children are studying in school:
examples: before/after school
School starts at 9 a.m. and finishes at 3.30 p.m.

body_content.explanation: all the children and teachers at a school:
examples: The whole school is/are delighted about Joel's success in the championships.

body_content.explanation: a part of a college or university specializing in a particular subject or group of subjects:
examples: the School of Oriental and African Studies
She went to medical school in Edinburgh.

body_content.explanation: a place where people can study a particular subject either some of the time or all of the time:
examples: a driving/dancing school
the London Business School

body_content.explanation: a college or university or the time that a student spends there:
examples: We first met in graduate school (= while doing a second or third university degree).
We went to school together in Atlanta.

body_content.explanation: a group of painters, writers, poets, etc. whose work is similar, especially similar to that of a particular leader:
examples: the Flemish School
the Impressionist school of painting

body_content.explanation: a large number of fish or other sea creatures swimming in a group:
examples: a school of dolphins/whales

body_content.explanation: to train a person or animal to do something:
examples: It takes a lot of patience to school a dog/horse.
You must school yourself to be tolerant.
Her children are well schooled in correct behaviour.
